INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: In case of prolonged use by oral or inhaled route: increase of the plasma concentrations of the corticoid due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the protease inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushing's syndrome, even of adrenal insufficiency

In case of prolonged use by oral or inhaled route: increase of the plasma concentrations of the corticoid due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the itraconazole, with risk of appearance of Cushing's syndrome, even of adrenal insufficiency

In case of prolonged use by oral or inhaled route: increase of the plasma concentrations of the corticoid due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ketoconazole, with risk of appearance of Cushing's syndrome, even of adrenal insufficiency

In case of prolonged use by oral or inhaled route: increase of the plasma concentrations of the corticoid due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the voriconazole, with risk of appearance of Cushing's syndrome, even of adrenal insufficiency
